episode_summary: This episode of 'No Such Thing As A Fish' covers a range of quirky and fascinating facts, including the unusual use of Dylan Thomas's coffin as a poker table, the surprising number of lakes in Canada, a Spanish football stadium's ban on sunflower seeds, and Singapore's high consumption of Scotch whisky.

facts.fact: Before he was buried, the poet Dylan Thomas was used as a poker table.
Six out of 10 lakes are in Canada.
At one Spanish football stadium, they will stop you from eating sunflower seeds, but they won't stop you from smoking.
Singaporeans drink more than a bottle of Scotch per person per month, which is twice as much as their nearest rivals.
